summary:
The built environment is de decor of human life!

While studying and working in multicultural and trans-disciplinary settings in the Netherlands, Greece, Nigeria and Thailand, I have noticed that Peace is a way of dealing with one another to understand the diversity of local-level expressions of global challenges. If we respect each other and make use of the learning potentials of mutual inspiration to govern transitions, then we operate with Peace.

Via these experiences, I 1) became particularly interested in the relationship between the physical environment and human behaviour, and consequently how places function, I 2) advocate an established role for the built environment in achieving the UN SDGs, and I 3) emphasize the relevance and role of education in context, i.e. the interconnectedness between education, research and practise to enhance learning and societal impact.

People I worked with describe me as a passionate, disciplined, spontaneous and well-mannered person who is open-minded and constantly eager to learn from others while being patient and understanding towards others to work to a better world.

Stefano Blezer

awards.title: Top 100 Cases for Social Innovation in Europe: WOOW
awards.description: Living, Education, Entrepreneurship and Work (Wonen, Opleiden, Ondernemen en Werken: WOOW) is a philosophy of thought and action. It aims to rethink the neighbourhoods and housing of the future by developing programs that deal with socioeconomic issues, housing, vitality and (human) well-being. WOOW 2020-2022 focuses on the labour market, specifically preparing refugees with certificates and/or experience in the construction and engineering sector in their home country for a career in Limburg, the Netherlands.

awards.title: Veli Pekka Niitamo Award for Best Practitioners Paper 2022
awards.description: Honored for the significant en thought-provoking paper entitled: ''Placemaking in the Urban Living Lab Heerlen and Aurora flat courtyard intervention: learning towards urban vitality in vulnerable and cultural diverse neighbourhoods'' with my colleagues Nurhan Abujidi and Herwin Sap. Especially due to our practical implementation of the urban living lab concept in research, education and neighbourhood development.
awards.issuer: European Network Of Living Labs on the annual Open Living Lab Days Conference

Certificate of Attendance - 2nd Peace Summit of Emerging Leaders 2020
Certificate of Completion - Green Growth Course

projects.title: City Deal Kennis Maken Limburg (Urban Living Lab)
projects.description: Within the project 'City Deal Kennis Maken Limburg', work is being done on urban transformations in neighborhoods in Maastricht, Heerlen and Sittard-Geleen. The neighborhoods are regarded as a learning environment in which students from different study programs collaborate interdisciplinary on the development of vital and future-proof neighbourhoods. Currently, the 7th year is running with cumulative results for education, research and local societal challenges.

projects.title: WOOW Project
projects.description:
WOOW is one of the top 100 Best Practises on social innovation in Europe in 2023.

WOOW stands for Wonen, Opleiden, Ondernemen en Werken (Living, Training, Entrepreneurship and Working). During the interdisciplinary project, vacancy of buildings, the reduction of the unemployment rate and the shortage of personnel in construction and installation industry in the Parkstad region will be tackled. Meanwhile, 30+ participants at MBO and HBO level have successfully completed the WOOW learn-work trajectory. The project is aimed at people who have an education and work experience in the construction and installation industry in their home country, but do not find a sufficient connection with the current labor market.

projects.title: Hands for Peace Project 2020
projects.description:
The Hands for Peace project aims to raise awareness about the SDGs, stimulate the dialogue about the concept of Peace, and the advocate the role of spatial planning in Peace and the SDGs. Hands are an accessible, committing, authentic and activating way to sparkle energy to contribute to a better world. No personal characteristics. A Hand shows ones familiarity with above mentioned to generate change.

Projects:
1) Hands for Peace collection on the Peace Summit of Emerging Leaders in Thailand 2020.
2) Hands for Peace online social media campaign on SDGs-Act University campuses in Nigera in 2021.
3) Hands for Peace actions during the WOOW and City Deal Kennis Maken projects during 2022.
4) Hands for Peace Liberation Day action for community-led park development in Heerlen in 2023.

projects.title: #CoCreateMyCityLagos Project 2019
projects.description:
The #CoCreateMyCityLagos Project 2019 is organised by the ECE and DutchCE in collaboration with the RVO, Dutch Ambassy in Nigeria, and Orange Corners.

Within the project 15 Dutch and 15 Nigerian students worked together to tackle five (urban) challenges in a multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary setting in the city of Lagos, Nigeria, as fastest growing smart city and economy in Africa. More specifically, I worked on beating the traffic jam that Lagos is facing every day. The project consisted of six online webinars and a field visit of two weeks to the city itself in June 2019.

My team members and the project setting taught me a lot about specific social entrepreneurial skills necessary to start and find business solutions to overcome urban challenges. Moreover, the insights about the role of entrepreneurship, education, culture and politics within the ecosystem of a mega city in the 21th century that the project gave me are of immense value for my own career and understanding of city dynamics!

company.name: Zuyd Hogeschool | Zuyd University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: Zuyd Hogeschool | Zuyd University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
Education-wise, I am 1) curious how to encourage student self-learning ability to let them explore their own interests, passion and personality, and 2) dedicated to work together with students on the application of knowledge accumulated in study courses, research skills and critical thinking to develop a professional work identity based on the principles of social learning theory.

Research-wise, I am involved in literature studies and applied research to topics on the crossroad of urban transformation and psycho-geography, i.e. improving the built environment with placemaking and Urban Living Labs as infrastructure for research, education and to address societal challenges. Examples are: the WOOW project, City Deal Kennis Maken Limburg initiative, or our Urban Living Labs to co-iterate and co-develop our trans-disciplinary approach to enhance local impacts in Limburg via knowledge development with partners.

volunteer_experiences.description: Project leader 'Streekboer' project at Zernike Campus. The project aimed to bring biological food from farmers to students and staff from the University of Groningen by installing a temporary pick up point at Zernike Campus. In so doing, reducing CO2 emissions, avoid unnecessary package materials, and preventing food waste.

Girugten is the faculty magazine of the Faculty of Spatial Sciences at the University of Groningen. As editor-in-chief, I was responsible for the content and process regarding the Faculty Magazine editions. As a co-designer, I was responsible for the appearance and composition of the magazine editions.

Written articles:
- The living lab concept: a new tool for urban planning and design.
- Carnival in the Netherlands; North versus South.

- Colourful risk governance in Willemstad, Curacao.
- Lagos, Nigeria; ‘’traffic, traffic, traffic. There is always traffic.’’
